{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2015}} {{Infobox person | image = | image_size = | name = Michael Hartono | caption = | birth_name = Michael Bambang Hartono | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1939|10|2|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Kudus, Kudus|Kudus]], [[Central Java]], Indonesia | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = Indonesian | education = | alma mater = [[Diponegoro University]] | occupation = Co-owner of [[Djarum]] and [[Bank Central Asia|BCA]] | salary = | networth = [[United States dollar|$]]10.7 billion (October 2018){{cite web|title=Forbes profile: Michael Hartono|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-hartono/|website=Forbes|accessdate=6 October 2018}} | spouse = | parents = [[Oei Wie Gwan]]
Goei Tjoe Nio | children = 4 | relatives = [[Robert Budi Hartono]] (brother) | website = }} {{Infobox Chinese |title = '''Michael Bambang Hartono''' |t = {{linktext|黃|輝|祥}}{{cite web | url=http://indonesia.sinchew.com.my/node/60311 | title=2016年05月09日 - 針記首席運營長黃志勝澄清‧黃家泉州無祖屋 - 國內 - 頭條新聞 - 印尼}} |s = {{linktext|黄|辉|祥}} |p = Huáng Huīxiáng }} {{MedalTableTop | name = no | sport = Mixed Group [[Contract Bridge]] | country = {{bkw|IDN}} | medals = {{MedalCompetition | [[Asian Games]] }} {{MedalBronze | [[2018 Asian Games ]] | Team competition }} }} '''Michael Bambang Hartono''' (born 2 October 1939 in [[Kudus, Kudus|Kudus]], [[Central Java]]), also known as '''Oei Gwie Siong''', is a [[Chinese Indonesians|Chinese Indonesian]] billionaire heir and businessman. Michael and his brother [[Robert Budi Hartono|Robert Budi]] are the owners of [[kretek]] (clove cigarette) manufacturer [[Djarum]], which they inherited from their father [[Oei Wie Gwan]] upon his death in 1963. Growing the business to a large conglomerate including [[Bank Central Asia]], electronics, plantations and various properties, they became the richest in the country with Michael himself having a net worth in excess of $10 billion. ==Early life== Michael Hartono was born on 2 October 1939 in the town of [[Kudus, Kudus|Kudus]], in [[Central Java]].{{cite news |title=Michael Hartono |url=https://tirto.id/m/michael-hartono-hX |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=tirto.id |language=id-ID}} His father, [[Oei Wie Gwan]], had purchased a small [[Kretek]] cigarette factory called ''Djarum Gramophon'' (lit: Gramophone needle) in April 1951, and renamed it to just ''Djarum''. In 1963, however, the factory burned down and shortly thereafter Oie Wie passed away, leaving Michael and his younger brother [[Robert Budi Hartono]] to inherit the factory.{{cite news |last1=Putra |first1=Idris Rusadi |title=Kisah Hartono bersaudara membangun kerajaan bisnis Djarum |url=https://www.merdeka.com/peristiwa/kisah-hartono-bersaudara-membangun-kerajaan-bisnis-djarum.html |date=1 February 2014 |language=id}}{{cite web |title=History of Djarum |url=http://www.djarum.com/world-of-djarum/history-of-djarum/ |publisher=Djarum}} After completing his highschool in Kudus, Michael studied in the faculty of economics and business at [[Diponegoro University]] starting 1959, but returned to Kudus upon his father's death.{{cite news |last1=Puspitarini |first1=Margaret |title=FEB Undip Beri Penghargaan untuk Alumni : Okezone News |url=https://news.okezone.com/read/2012/03/22/373/598035/feb-undip-beri-penghargaan-untuk-alumni |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Okezone |date=22 March 2012 |language=id-ID}}{{sfn|Setyautama|2008|p=264}} ==Career== The cigarette company grew under the two brothers, making its first export in 1972 and introducing new products. Today, the cigarette brand is one of the largest in Indonesia, with a 19 percent market share in 2012. As the cigarette business continued to grow, the group began expanding to other fields, founding an electronics brand [[Polytron (Indonesian brand)|Polytron]] in 1975.{{cite news |last1=Suryadi |first1=Dede |title=Empat Dekade Kiprah Polytron |url=https://swa.co.id/swa/capital-market/corporate/empat-dekade-kiprah-polytron |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=SWA |date=30 March 2016 |language=id}} The group also expanded into businesses like palm oil, papermaking and communication towers.{{cite news |title=Ini Bisnis Sampingan Grup Djarum di Luar Rokok |url=https://ekonomi.kompas.com/read/2015/04/10/113200826/Ini.Bisnis.Sampingan.Grup.Djarum.di.Luar.Rokok |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=10 April 2015 |language=id}}{{cite news |last1=Suhartono |first1=Harry |title=Indonesian Billionaire Brothers Are Turning Their Focus on Telecom |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-04-10/richest-indonesians-chase-tower-assets-as-internet-users-swell |accessdate=31 August 2018 |work=Bloomberg |date=11 April 2018}} Starting their entry into the banking business through Haga Bank and Hagakita Bank,{{cite news |last1=Atmanto |first1=Irwan Andri |last2=Firdaus |first2=Haris |title=Imperium Bisnis Keluarga Hartono |url=http://arsip.gatra.com/2011-04-01/majalah/artikel.php?pil=23&id=146912 |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Gatra |date=1 April 2011 |language=id}} the brothers under the [[Mauritius]]-registered corporation FarIndo Investments in a consortium with [[Farallon Capital]] took over 51.15% of [[Bank Central Asia]] in 2002, defeating other bidders despite making a lower offer.{{cite news |title='Masters of the universe' behind BCA sale |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2002/BUSINESS/asia/03/19/indonesia.farallon/ |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=CNN |date=20 March 2002}} While initially only holding less than 10% stake in the consortium, Djarum held a 92.18% stake in the consortium by 2006, though the Haga and Hagakita Banks were sold to [[Rabobank]].{{cite news |title=Thomas Lembong yang Diangkat Jadi Menteri Perdagangan Pernah "Beli" BCA |url=https://www.bareksa.com/id/text/2015/08/12/thomas-lembong-yang-diangkat-jadi-menteri-perdagangan-pernah-beli-bca/11178/news |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Bareksa |date=12 August 2015 |language=id}}{{cite news |title=Lepas Bank Haga & Hagakita, Bos Djarum Kuasai BCA |url=https://finance.detik.com/moneter/d-730929/lepas-bank-haga--hagakita-bos-djarum-kuasai-bca- |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Detik |date=16 January 2007 |language=id}} After a Rp 3.45 trillion deal with [[UBS]] in 2010, the brothers controlled a majority of the company's shares.{{cite news |title=Beli Saham Rp 3,45 Triliun, Orang Terkaya RI Kuasai Mayoritas BCA |url=https://finance.detik.com/bursa-dan-valas/d-1529645/beli-saham-rp-345-triliun-orang-terkaya-ri-kuasai-mayoritas-bca |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Detik |date=21 December 2010 |language=id}} The shares were transferred to an Indonesian holding company PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan in 2016 during a tax amnesty program.{{cite news |last1=Afriyadi |first1=Achmad Dwi |title=47,15 Persen Saham BCA Pindah Tangan |url=https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/2652965/4715-persen-saham-bca-pindah-tangan |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=15 November 2016 |language=id}} As of September 2017, the company was jointly held by Michael and Robert, and possessed a 54.94% stake in BCA.{{cite web |title=Pemegang Saham PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) per 30 September 2017 |url=https://www.bca.co.id/id/Tentang-BCA/Hubungan-Investor/Saham-BCA |publisher=Bank Central Asia |accessdate=29 August 2018 |language=id}} Aside from the aforementioned businesses, the Djarum group also controls several shopping malls and buildings in Jakarta, including [[Grand Indonesia]], [[Hotel Indonesia]] and [[BCA Tower]].{{cite news |last1=Suhendra |first1=Zulfi |title=Mengenal Duo Hartono, Orang Paling Kaya di Indonesia |url=https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/2384102/mengenal-duo-hartono-orang-paling-kaya-di-indonesia |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=liputan6 |date=7 December 2015 |language=id}} According to ''[[Forbes]]'', Hartono has a net worth of $10.7 billion, as of October 2018, making him the 75th richest person in the world. He and his brother – who was also listed slightly above him at 69th{{cite web |title=#69 R. Budi Hartono |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/r-budi-hartono/#69a112e5e17b |publisher=Forbes |accessdate=29 August 2018}} – were named as the richest Indonesians in 2017, the 9th year in a row they were listed as such.{{cite news |last1=Suhendra |first1=Zulfi |title=Budi dan Michael Hartono Jadi Orang Terkaya RI Selama 9 Tahun |url=https://finance.detik.com/berita-ekonomi-bisnis/d-3756606/budi-dan-michael-hartono-jadi-orang-terkaya-ri-selama-9-tahun |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Detik |date=6 December 2017 |language=id}} His company is also active in internet ventures, controlling e-commerce website [[:id:Blibli.com|Blibli.com]] and one of Indonesia's largest online communities [[Kaskus]].{{cite news |title=Robert Hartono, 75 and Michael Hartono, 76 |url=http://jakartaglobe.id/uncategorized/robert-hartono-75-michael-hartono-76/ |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Jakarta Globe |date=1 July 2016}} ==Personal life== He lives in [[Kudus, Kudus|Kudus]], Indonesia and is married to Widowati Hartono. The couple has four children.{{cite news |last1=Kertiyasa |first1=Martin Bagya |title=HOT SHOT: Budi Hartono, 8 Tahun Jadi Orang Paling Kaya di Indonesia |url=https://economy.okezone.com/read/2016/12/03/320/1558067/hot-shot-budi-hartono-8-tahun-jadi-orang-paling-kaya-di-indonesia |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Okezone |date=3 December 2016 |language=id}} Bambang is a [[Contract bridge|bridge]] player. In an interview, he said that "bridge is how you train yourself in making good decisions and risk-taking" and that his uncle introduced him to the game during the [[Japanese occupation of the Dutch East Indies|Japanese occupation of Indonesia]].{{cite news |last1=Sipatuhar |first1=Tassia |title=Cigarette Billionaire Quits Wine in Pursuit of Asian Gold Medal |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-22/indonesian-billionaire-gives-up-wine-in-pursuit-of-asian-gold |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=Bloomberg |date=23 August 2018}} A major supporter of the sport in the country and president of the South East Asia Bridge Federation, he received an award from the [[World Bridge Federation]] in 2017 for his support in making bridge a category in the Asian Games.{{cite web |title=APBF 60th Anniversary |url=http://www.worldbridge.org/2017/05/29/apbf-60th-anniversary-michael-bambang-hartono-awarded-with-the-wbf-gold-medal/ |publisher=World Bridge Federation |accessdate=29 August 2018}} He represented Indonesia at the [[Contract bridge at the 2018 Asian Games|Asian Games 2018 in bridge]], winning a bronze medal with his team at the [[Contract bridge at the 2018 Asian Games – Supermixed team|Supermixed team event]] hence making him the oldest Indonesian Asian Games medal winner.{{cite news |last1=Yadika |first1=Bawono |title=Ternyata Bos Djarum, Sosok yang Majukan Bridge di Indonesia |url=https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/3626570/ternyata-bos-djarum-sosok-yang-majukan-bridge-di-indonesia |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=23 August 2018 |language=id}}{{cite news |title=Asian Games 2018: 'Persistent' Indonesian billionaire wins bridge bronze aged 78 |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/45328519 |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=BBC Sport |date=28 August 2018}} He was the oldest athlete in the [[Indonesia at the 2018 Asian Games|Indonesian contingent]], though several other non-Indonesian bridge players were older.{{cite news |title=Meet The Billionaire Bridge Player Who Holds All The Cards |url=https://www.ndtv.com/world-news/meet-michael-bambang-hartono-the-billionaire-bridge-player-who-holds-all-the-cards-1907425 |accessdate=29 August 2018 |work=NDTV |date=28 August 2018}} He had also {{BLP sources|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox person | name = Mika Salmi | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1965|11|16}} | birth_place = [[Finland]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = [[Americans|American]] | other_names = | occupation = [[Businessperson]] | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Mika Salmi''' (born 16 November 1965) is a Finnish-born American entrepreneur, and executive in technology and media.
==Biography== Salmi is a senior advisor at The Raine Group, an investment and advisory firm focused on the media, entertainment and sports industries.<ref name=N>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/06/15/technology/hollywood-flirts-with-short-films-on-the-web.html|title=Hollywood Flirts With Short Films on the Web|author=Houston, Frank|date=June 15, 2000|work=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> He also serves on the Boards of [[INSEAD]], Trace, Pixvana, [[CreativeLive]], and Feed.fm and actively advises numerous startups.
Prior to Raine, he served as CEO of [[CreativeLive]].{{When|date=January 2017}}.
Salmi promoted [[new media]] as president of global digital media for [[MTV Networks]]/[[Viacom]]. He reported to the chairman and CEO of MTV Networks, [[Judy McGrath]].{{When|date=January 2017}}
Salmi was CEO and founder of [[Atom Entertainment]],<ref name=N/> which was purchased by [[Viacom]] for $200 million in 2006. In 1998 Salmi founded [[Atom.com|AtomFilms]],<ref name=N/> an online film and humor site, which featured artists such as [[Jason Reitman]] and [[JibJab]]. Atom had three brands, AtomFilms, Shockwave and AddictingGames, which together had over 40 million monthly active users. AtomFilms was one of the first and largest online video companies and was the YouTube of its day. Shockwave was the largest game brand on the internet and was complemented by AddictingGames, which was the fastest growing casual games website.
Before founding Atom, Salmi worked at [[RealNetworks]]. Salmi began his entertainment career in the music business, working at [[Sony Music International]], [[EMI Music]] and [[TVT Records]]. While at TVT Records he saw multi-Platinum selling and Grammy winning artist [[Nine Inch Nails]] opening for another band, and asked for a demo tape. He worked with TVT's head of A&R, Kitty Overton, who, with Steve Gottlieb, the founder of TVT, to sign the band.
Other companies where Salmi is serving or has served on the board of directors include [[Inkd]] (acquired by [[RealSelf]]), [[Elisa (company)|Elisa]] (Finland's largest telecom company), [[Blinkbox]] (acquired by Tesco), [[Image Metrics]] (went public), Shockwave KK (acquired by Transcosmos/Japan), and Propel Renewable Fuels (innovator in alternative energy distribution).
Regularly included in lists of industry trailblazers, Salmi has appeared in ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', ''[[Forbes]]'', ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' and numerous international publications. He has been profiled by ''[[The Wall Street Journal]''], ''[[The New York Times]]'', ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', ''[[Newsweek]]'', ''[[USA Today]]'', ''[[Business Week]]'', and several other US and foreign newspapers. Salmi has appeared on television news programs and morning talk shows, including [[ABC News]], [[BBC News]], [[CNN]], [[CNBC]], and [[The Today Show]], and has delivered high profile keynote speeches around the world.
Salmi has an MBA from [http://www.insead.edu INSEAD].

{{refimprove|date=April 2017}} The term '''multilateral trade negotiations''' (MTN) initially applied to negotiations between [[General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade]] (GATT) member nations conducted under the auspices of the GATT and aimed at reducing tariff and nontariff trade barriers. In 1995 the [[World Trade Organization]] (WTO) replaced the GATT as the administrative body. A current round of multilateral trade negotiations was conducted in the [[Doha Development Agenda]] round.
Prior to the ongoing [[Doha Development Round]], eight GATT sessions took place:
* 1st Round: Geneva Tariff Conference, 1947 * 2nd Round: Annecy Tariff Conference, 1949 * 3rd Round: Torquay Tariff Conference, 1950-51 * 4th Round: Geneva Tariff Conference, 1955-56 * 5th Round: Dillon Round, 1960-61 * 6th Round: Kennedy Round, 1963-67 * 7th Round: Tokyo Round, 1973-79 * 8th Round: [[Uruguay Round]], 1986-94
The third [[Ministerial Conference|WTO Ministerial Conference]] in Seattle, 1999, was intended to start the [[Millennium Round]] of negotiations.
== References == *{{CRS|article = Report for Congress: Agriculture: A Glossary of Terms, Programs, and Laws, 2005 Edition|url = http://ncseonline.org/nle/crsreports/05jun/97-905.pdf|author= Jasper Womach}} *[http://worldtradereview.com/webpage.asp?wID=431|The World Trade Review]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Multilateral Trade Negotiations}} [[Category:International trade]] [[Category:Multilateral relations]]

The '''Paul E. Garber Award''' is given to [[Civil Air Patrol]] (CAP) [[Civil Air Patrol#Senior members|Senior Members]] who complete Level IV of the Senior Member Professional Development Program.<ref>{{cite web|title=CAPR 39-3 Award of CAP Medals, Ribbons, and Certificates|url=https://www.capmembers.com/media/cms/R039_003_83459660D4F44.pdf}}</ref> It recognizes those members who have dedicated themselves to leadership and personal development in the CAP. This award was first given in 1964 and honors [[Paul E. Garber]]. Mr. Garber was a noted aviation pioneer, curator emeritus of the [[National Air and Space Museum]], and early champion of Civil Air Patrol.
Civil Air Patrol is the Auxiliary of the [[United States Air Force]]. CAP has a three-fold mission. It includes emergency services, the cadet program, and aerospace education. CAP professional development provides technical skills and leadership training to senior members age 18 and over to support CAP’s mission. The program enables these adults to develop these skills while providing a vital public service to the US nation.
As the member progresses through the program, he or she completes five increasingly complex training levels. Each level requires the member to become more involved in CAP activities, master skills in one of 23 technical areas, and develop leadership ability. As he or she completes these levels, the member receives awards, chances for promotion, and selection for more important roles within CAP.
The fourth milestone is the Garber Award. It is earned after receiving the [[Grover Loening Award]]. In addition, members must inform their communities about CAP. They must train fellow members in a variety of courses. They must serve in command or leadership positions for at least two years. Finally, they must complete CAP’s mid-level leadership course, Region Staff College, or approved equivalent.
Of CAP’s 35,000 senior members, less than 200 earn the Paul E. Garber Award annually.{{Citation needed|date=January 2017}} Receipt of the award and completion of rank and time-in-grade requirements also makes the member eligible for promotion to CAP Major.
After receiving the Garber Award, participants may go on to the [[Gill Robb Wilson Award]].

{{infobox person/Wikidata | fetchwikidata=ALL}} '''Peter Schröcksnadel''' (born July 30, 1941 in Innsbruck) is an Austrian entrepreneur and since 1990 President of the Austrian Ski Federation (ÖSV), from 2009 to 2012 President of the [[European Ski Federation]] (ESF)<ref name="orf-154773">{{cite web|title=Ungarin folgt Schröcksnadel als ESF-Chefin|periodical=sport.orf.at|publisher=|url=http://sport.orf.at/stories/2154773/|deadurl=|format=|accessdate=2017-01-18|archiveurl=|archivedate=|last=|date=2012-12-05|year=|month=|day=|language=German|pages=|quote=}}</ref> and former vice president of the [[Austrian Olympic Committee]].
== Life == In Innsbruck, he completed his [[Matura]] at a Handelsakademie in 1959. He studied law. In 1964, he founded Sitour Austria in Innsbruck and produced panorama and slope marking boards as well as slope guidance systems ("signalisation touristique"). His second company, Feratel Media Technologies AG, founded in 1978, developed in the early 1990s panoramic image, live broadcast weather panorama television as a tourist marketing tool, which is broadcast by various television networks. At the same time, the company develops eTourism products for the European market.
From 1978 to 1990, Peter Schröcksnadel was an instructor for general skiing in the Austrian Schiverband and from 1987 to 1990 was vice president, and then president. In 1992, he was awarded the title of professor by the Federal Ministry of Science.
As a result of the doping scandal during the [[2006 Winter Olympics]], Schröcksnadel resigned from his post as Vice President of the Austrian Olympic Committee (ÖOC) the following year.<ref>''[http://spiegel.de/sport/sonst/0,1518,485410,00.html Doping im Wintersport: Ausschluss für Österreicher, Sperre für Langläufer]''. </ref>
In the run-up to the [[2014 Winter Olympics]] in [[Sochi]], Russia, Peter Schröcksnadel spoke in a newspaper interview about the political discussions surrounding Russia's policy. He criticized a boycott of the games demanded by politicians, and was pleased that the Chancellor and the Minister of Sport of Austria wanted to visit the games. He did not want to judge the human rights violations in Russia, and advised athletes not to speak out politically. He interpreted the release of political prisoners as a positive impact of the Winter Olympics in Sochi.<ref>{{cite web|title="Würde keinem Sportler raten, sich politisch zu äußern"|periodical=Der Standard|publisher=|url=http://derstandard.at/1388650057170/Ich-wuerde-keinem-Sportler-raten-sich-politisch-zu-aeussern|deadurl=|format=|accessdate=2017-11-28|archiveurl=|archivedate=|last=|date=2014-01-03|year=|month=|day=|language=German|pages=|quote=}}</ref>
== Schröcksnadel Group == In addition to his work as ÖSV President, Peter Schröcksnadel is Managing Director of four ÖSV subsidiaries, namely Austria Skiteam Handels und Beteiligungs GmbH, Austria Ski Nordic Event GmbH, Austria Ski WM and Großveranstaltungs GmbH and Austria Ski Veranstaltungs GmbH. The companies are among the most important organizers of major events and other winter tourism events in Austria.
He is also managing director of Sitour Management GmbH.<ref>''[http://www.firmenabc.at/sitour-marketing-gmbh_BOKl Sitour Marketing GmbH].'' </ref>Today, the company operates in Austria with 30 employees worldwide and is represented in several countries in Europe, the USA and Japan . The company is now part of the Feratel Group.
== Awards == [[File:Sportler_des_Jahres_2013_Österreich_Peter_Schröcksnadel_Gerald_Klug.jpg|thumb|Peter Schröcksnadel, winner of the 2013 Special Award, and Minister [[Gerald Klug]]]] * 1999 Decoration of Tyrol * 2000 Golden Medal of Styria * 2011 [[Decoration of Honour for Services to the Republic of Austria]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Großes Ehrenzeichen für Peter Schröcksnadel|periodical=[[Niederösterreichische Nachrichten]]|publisher=|url=http://www.noen.at/sport/noe-sportmix/grosses-ehrenzeichen-fuer-peter-schroecksnadel/4.955.317|deadurl=|format=|accessdate=2017-11-28|archiveurl=|archivedate=|last=|date=2011-07-21|year=|month=|day=|language=German|pages=|quote=}}</ref> * 2013 Special Lifetime Award for Austria's Sportsman of the Year. * Honorary citizen of Schladming * 2013 Honorary Senator of the University of Innsbruck
== References == <references />

{{other uses|Principal (disambiguation)}} {{Globalize|date=October 2010}} In [[commercial law]], a '''principal''' is a person, [[Legal person|legal]] or [[Natural person|natural]], who authorizes an [[Agent (law)|agent]] to act to create one or more legal relationships with a [[:wikt:third party|third party]]. This branch of law is called [[Agency (law)|agency]] and relies on the [[common law]] proposition '''''qui facit per alium, facit per se''''' ([[Latin]] "he who acts through another, acts personally").
It is a parallel concept to [[vicarious liability]] and [[strict liability]] (in which one person is held liable for the acts or omissions of another) in [[criminal law]] or [[tort]]s.
==Concepts== In a busy commercial world, the smooth flow of trade depends on the use of agents. This may be because in [[business entity|business entities]] such as: *[[sole trader]]s, their ability to conduct business will always be limited unless other people are used to work on their behalf; *a [[partnership]], the [[natural person]]s who are involved cannot be present to conduct business in multiple locations simultaneously, so they must rely on others to make agreements or deliver services on their behalf; or *a [[corporation]] is only a [[Juristic person|legal entity]] or fictitious legal person and so can only act through the agency of human beings to get anything done. In the majority of cases, it is impossible for agents to seek specific authority for every deal or detail within a deal. Agents must, of necessity, be allowed some degree of discretion in the conduct of routine transactions. But, for the purposes of ascribing legal responsibility to the Principal, when the Agent acts with actual or apparent authority, all the Agent's knowledge will be [[imputation (law)|imputed]] to the Principal. If Principals were allowed to hide behind their agents' own ignorance, mistakes or failures to communicate, a Principal could, by using an Agent, achieve a better result than if they acted personally. For example, if the particular deal turned out well, the Principal could adopt the transaction. But, if it turned out badly, the Principal could disavow it. Indeed, if not for imputation, there would be a [[perverse incentive]] to conduct business through Agents rather than personally. Consequently, the Principal cannot exploit ignorance to their advantage by instructing the Agent to withhold key information or by appointing an Agent known to be secretive.
This rule in favour of imputation relates to the duties an Agent owes a Principal, in particular the Agent's duty to communicate material facts to the Principal. Since the purpose of the law is to offer protection to Third Parties who have acted in [[good faith]], it is reasonable to allow them to believe that, in most cases, the Agents have fulfilled this duty. After all, the Principal selects the Agents and has the power to control their actions both through express instructions and incentives intended to influence their behaviour which will include laying down routines for how Agents should handle information, and the extent to which Agents will be rewarded for transmitting information of commercial value. The result is a form of strict liability in which the legal consequences of an Agent's acts or omissions are attributed to a Principal even when the Principal was without fault in appointing or supervising the Agent. Borrowing parallel concepts from Tort and [[Equity (law)|Equity]], this means that the Principal owes the Third Party a [[duty of care]] to ensure that the Agent is honest and efficient, and that a Principal is [[estoppel|estopped]] from denying that an Agent was authorised to act as they did.
==Summary of law== There are three classes of Principal: {| class="wikitable" |+3 classes of principal !Class !Description |- |Disclosed |at the time of the transaction made by the Agent with the Third Party, the latter knows that the person he is dealing with is acting as an Agent and also knows the Principal’s identity. |- |Partially disclosed |at the time of the transaction, the Third Party knows that the person he is dealing with is acting as an Agent but does not know the Principal’s identity. |- |Undisclosed |The person acting as an Agent represents they are acting on their own behalf and does not disclose the existence of the agency relationship. |}
===Authority=== For these purposes, the Principal must give, or be deemed to give, the Agent authority to act. *Actual authority :This arises where the Principal's words or conduct reasonably cause the Agent to believe they have been authorised to act. This may be expressed as a [[contract]] or implied because what is said or done make it reasonably necessary for the person to assume the powers of an Agent. If it is clear that the Principal gave actual authority to Agent, all the Agent's actions falling within the scope of the authority given bind the Principal. This results even if, having actual authority, the Agent in fact acts [[fraud]]ulently for his own benefit, unless the Third Party was aware of the Agent's personal agenda. If there is no contract but the Principal's words or conduct reasonably led the Third Party to believe that the Agent was authorised to act, or if what the Agent proposes to do is incidental and reasonably necessary to accomplish an actually authorised transaction or a transaction that usually accompanies it, then the Principal is bound. *Apparent or [[ostensible authority]] :If the Principal's words or conduct would lead a reasonable person in the Third Party’s position to believe that the Agent was authorised to act, say by appointing the Agent to a position which carries with it agency-like powers, those who know of the appointment are entitled to assume that there is apparent authority to do the things ordinarily entrusted to one occupying such a position. If a Principal creates the impression that an Agent is authorised but there is no actual authority, Third Parties are protected so long as they have acted reasonably. This is sometimes termed "Agency by [[Estoppel]]" or the "Doctrine of Holding Out", where the Principal is stopped from denying the grant of authority if Third Parties have changed their positions to their detriment in reliance on the representations made. *Authority by virtue of a position held :For example, [[partnership|partners]] have apparent authority to bind the other partners in the firm, their liability being joint and several, and in a [[corporation]], all executives and senior employees with decision-making authority by virtue of their declared position have apparent authority to bind the corporation. Even if the Agent does act without authority, the Principal may ratify the transaction and accept liability on the transactions as negotiated. This may be express or implied from the Principal's behaviour, e.g. if the Agent has purported to act in a number of situations and the Principal has knowingly acquiesced, the failure to notify all concerned of the Agent's lack of authority is an implied ratification to those transactions and an implied grant of authority for future transactions of a similar nature.mithun '''
===Liability===
====Agent to Principal==== If the Agent has acted without actual authority, but the Principal is nevertheless bound because the Agent had apparent authority, the Agent is liable to indemnify the Principal for any resulting loss or damage.
====Principal to Agent==== If the Agent has acted within the scope of the actual authority given, the Principal must indemnify the Agent for payments made during the course of the relationship whether the expenditure was expressly authorized or merely necessary in promoting the Principal’s business.
====Third Party to Principal==== The Third Party is liable to the Principal on the terms of the agreement made with the Agent, unless the Principal was undisclosed and there is clear evidence that either the Agent or the Principal knew that the Third Party would not have entered into the agreement if they had known of the Principal's involvement.
===Duties=== The relationship between a Principal and an Agent is [[fiduciary duty|fiduciary]] which requires the Agent to be loyal to the Principal. This involves duties: *not to accept any new obligations that are inconsistent with the duties owed to the Principal. Agents can represent the interests of more than one Principal, conflicting or potentially conflicting, only on the basis of full and timely disclosure or where the different agencies are based on a limited form of authority to prevent a situation where the Agent's loyalty to the any one of the multiple Principals is compromised. For this purpose, express clauses in the agreement signed by each Principal with the Agent may identify specific types or categories of activities that do not breach the duty of loyalty and so long as these exceptions are not unreasonable, they bind the Principals. *not to make a private profit or unjustly enrich himself from the agency relationship. Principals usually include a power in their contract with the Agents allowing them to inspect the Agents' accounts if reasonable suspicion of improper behavior emerges. In return, the Principal must make a full disclosure of all information relevant to the transactions that the Agent is authorized to negotiate and pay the Agent either the [[Commission (remuneration)|commission]] or fee as agreed, or a reasonable fee if none were previously agreed on.
===Remedies against agent=== The principal has the following remedies against the agent for breaching his/her [[fiduciary duty]]:<ref name="KubasekPPT">Slide 9 of [http://highered.mheducation.com/sites/0073524972/student_view0/chapter19/powerpoint_presentations.html Chapter 19 Powerpoint] for text {{cite book|last1=Kubasek|first1=Nancy|last2=Browne|first2=M. Neil|last3=Heron|first3=Daniel|last4=Dhooge|first4=Lucien|last5=Barkacs|first5=Linda|title=Dynamic Business Law: The Essentials|date=2013|publisher=McGraw-Hill|isbn=0073524972|edition=2d|url=http://highered.mheducation.com/sites/0073524972/information_center_view0/table_of_contents.html}}</ref><ref name="Kubasek">{{cite book|last1=Kubasek|first1=Nancy|last2=Browne|first2=M. Neil|last3=Heron|first3=Daniel|last4=Dhooge|first4=Lucien|last5=Barkacs|first5=Linda|title=Dynamic Business Law: The Essentials|date=2016|publisher=McGraw-Hill|isbn=9781259415654|edition=3d|page=422|url=http://highered.mheducation.com/sites/0073524972/information_center_view0/table_of_contents.html}}</ref>
====Constructive trust==== If the agent wrongfully holds property that should be owned or entitled to the principal, the principal can ask the court to deem it a [[constructive trust]]—that the agent is holding the property on behalf of the principal.<ref name="Kubasek"/><ref name="KubasekPPT"/>
====Avoidance====
The principal can void contracts negotiated by an agent that breached his or her fiduciary duty.<ref name="Kubasek"/><ref name="KubasekPPT"/>
====Indemnification====
The principal can sue the agent for liability caused by the agent's wrongful acts, i.e. if a third party obtained a judgment against the principal for wrongful acts caused by the agent, the principal can sue the agent to recover the loss.<ref name="Kubasek"/><ref name="KubasekPPT"/>
====Negligence (for not following instructions)====
A principal can sue for the negligence of an agent who '''failed to follow instructions''', unless it was simply a failure to follow the principal's ''advice''.<ref name="Kubasek"/>
===Undisclosed principal=== An '''Undisclosed principal''' is an unrevealed one, in a situation involving an undisclosed [[agency (law)|agency]].<ref>Ballentine's Law Dictionary, p. 563 (2001).</ref> It is "a person who uses an agent for his/her negotiations with a third party, often when the agent pretends to be acting for himself/herself." <ref>[http://dictionary.law.com/default2.asp?selected=2188&bold=%7C%7C%7C%7C Law.com definition]</ref> In a [[real estate]] transaction, this could be any "major party to a transaction, such as a seller or purchaser of property," who wishes to remain anonymous.<ref>[http://www.realestateagent.com/glossary/real-estate-glossary-show-term-1828-undisclosed-principal.html Real Estate Agent.com web page]</ref>
Some taxing authorities have created [[Law|rules]] regarding tax liability for actions of an undisclosed principal.<ref>The Department of Revenue of the State of Illinois v. Taxpayer, ST 97-12, found at [http://www.revenue.state.il.us/legalinformation/hearings/st/st97-12.pdf State of Illinois government web site].</ref> The undisclosed agency may also affect [[tort]] [[Legal liability|liability]].<ref>''Wahab Janitorial Services v. P.M. Group Mgt.'', 161 Ohio App.3d 632, 2007-Ohio-3037 (2005), found at [http://www.sconet.state.oh.us/rod/newpdf/1/2005/2005-Ohio-3037.pdf Pdf file of ''Wahab Janitorial Services'' case] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061230191847/http://www.sconet.state.oh.us/rod/newpdf/1/2005/2005-ohio-3037.pdf |date=2006-12-30 }}</ref>
===Termination=== The Principal can terminate an Agent's authority at any time without having to give notice. If the trust between the Agent and Principal has broken down, it is not reasonable to allow the Principal to remain at risk in any transactions that the Agent might conclude during a period of notice.
==Economic analysis== {{main|Principal–agent problem}}
The analysis of principal-agent relationships is an important topic in economics. The main focus of analysis is on the [[information asymmetry]] between the agent, who is assumed to be well informed, and the principal who may not be.
==See also== * [[Agency (law)]] * [[Agent (law)]] * [[Commissionaire]] * [[Corporate officer]] * [[Employee]] * [[Independent contractor]] * [[Insider trading]] * [[Principal (criminal law)]] * [[Seal (contract law)]]

{{one source|date=April 2017}} The '''Public Services''' of [[Sri Lanka]] are a series of services groups that provide specialized professional services to the [[Government of Sri Lanka]]. These are government employees who carry out public duties, however they are not elected officials. The most senior of these is the [[Sri Lanka Administrative Service]] which is the country's permanent [[bureaucracy]]. The Sri Lankan Government is the largest employer in the country and the public services are often criticized as overstaffed and inefficient.<ref name="SLDOS"/>
Their members are selected by competitive examination and promotions are made by the [[Civil service commission|Public Service Commission]].
==Public Services== ;(Professionals) *[[Sri Lanka Administrative Service]] *[[Sri Lanka Overseas Service]] *[[Sri Lanka Police|Sri Lanka Police Service]] *[[Sri Lanka Customs|Sri Lanka Customs Service]] *Sri Lanka Inland Revenue Service *[[Ministry of Education (Sri Lanka)|Sri Lanka Educational Administrative Service]] *Sri Lanka Accountants' Service *Sri Lanka Medical Service *Sri Lanka Planning Service *Sri Lanka Agricultural Service *Sri Lanka Valuers' Service *Sri Lanka Scientific Service *Sri Lanka Engineering Service *Sri Lanka Animal Protection and Health Service *Sri Lanka Surveyors' Service *Sri Lanka Architects Service *Sri Lanka Technical Education Service *Sri Lanka Technical Service *Sri Lanka Translators' Service *[[Judicial Service of Sri Lanka|Judicial Service]] *[[Attorney-General's Department (Sri Lanka)|Legal Officers]] *[[Department of Wildlife Conservation|Island Wildlife Service]] *Nursing Service *Principle Service *Teaching Service *Sri Lanka Development Officers’ Service<ref name="SLDOS">[http://www.lankabusinessonline.com/fullstory.php?nid=818968589 Sri Lanka govt expands overstaffed public service] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312141830/http://www.lankabusinessonline.com/fullstory.php?nid=818968589 |date=2012-03-12 }}</ref>

'''Rebeca Minguela''' is a Spanish entrepreneur<ref name="autogenerated1"/><ref name="ElPais">{{cite news|url=http://elpais.com/diario/2012/02/06/radiotv/1328482801_850215.html|title=Ganga hotelera en el movil|publisher=[[El Pais]]|date=2012-02-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.larazon.es/5774-el-20-de-las-reservas-de-hotel-ya-se-hacen-desde-el-movil-GLLA_RAZON_484655#.Ttt1AXQf5bZs71H|title=El 20% de las reservas de hotel ya se hacen desde el movil|publisher=[[La Razón (Madrid)|La Razon]]|date=2012-10-21}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.expansion.com/agencia/efe/2012/11/01/17764181.html|title=Blink, una aplicación de reserva de hoteles para viajeros perezosos|publisher=[[Expansión (Spanish newspaper)|Expansión]]|date=2011-11-01}}</ref> and startup advisor.<ref name="smileandlearn1">{{cite web|url=http://smileandlearn.net/en/about-us/|title=Smile & Learn - Sonrie y Aprende|work=smileandlearn.net}}</ref><ref name="columbusglobalsolutions1">{{cite web|url=http://columbusglobalsolutions.com/people/|title=Columbus Global Solutions - PEOPLE|work=Columbus Global Solutions|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150526065206/http://columbusglobalsolutions.com/people/|archivedate=2015-05-26|df=}}</ref> Founder and [[Chief Executive Officer|CEO]] of Blink Booking,<ref name="HBR">{{cite news|url=https://hbr.org/2015/06/how-local-context-shapes-digital-business-abroad|title=How local context shapes digital business abroad |publisher=[[Harvard Business Review]]|date=2015-06-24}}</ref> now [[:es:Blink by Groupon|Blink by Groupon]], an award winning <ref name="shabanaadam">{{cite web|url=http://www.femalefirst.co.uk/travel/travel+app+of+the+week-252766.html|title=Travel App of the Week: Blink Booking|author=Shabana Adam|date=15 August 2012|work=femalefirst.co.uk}}</ref><ref name="travolution1">{{cite web|url=http://www.travolution.co.uk/articles/2012/10/24/6113/travolution-awards-2012-the-winners-revealed.html|title=Travolution Awards 2012 - the winners revealed|work=travolution.co.uk}}</ref><ref name="centrodeinnovacionbbva1">{{cite web|url=http://www.centrodeinnovacionbbva.com/blogs/emprendedores/post/conoce-los-20-finalistas-de-bbva-open-talent-2013|title=Conoce a los 20 finalistas de BBVA Open Talent 2013|work=centrodeinnovacionbbva.com}}</ref> mobile app to book hotels last minute in Europe. When Blink was acquired by [[Groupon]] in September 2013,<ref name="venturebeat1">{{cite news|url=https://venturebeat.com/2013/09/09/groupon-acquires-travel-app-blink-to-offer-last-minute-european-vacations-cheap/|title=Groupon Acquires Travel App Blink |publisher=[[VentureBeat]]|date=2013-09-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://mashable.com/2013/09/09/groupon-acquires-blink-booking/|title=Groupon Acquires Blink Booking|publisher=[[Mashable]]|date=2013-09-09}}</ref> she joined Groupon.
Rebeca is co-founder of Global Impact Rating, startup selected for the [[Harvard innovation lab|Harvard Innovation Lab]] - iLab (Harvard Business School Incubator)<ref>{{Cite web|url = https://i-lab.harvard.edu/meet/venture-team/global-impact-rating/|title = Global Impact Rating - The Harvard Innovation Lab|website = The Harvard Innovation Lab|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-05-16}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.globalimpactrating.com/founding-team/|title = http://www.globalimpactrating.com/founding-team/|website = www.globalimpactrating.com|access-date = 2016-05-16}}</ref> in 2015.
Rebeca was selected [[Young Global Leaders|Young Global Leader]] of [[World Economic Forum]] in March 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://widgets.weforum.org/ygl-2017/|title=Young Global Leaders class of 2017|website=widgets.weforum.org|language=en|access-date=2017-04-17}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.europapress.es/economia/macroeconomia-00338/noticia-foro-economico-mundial-reconoce-espanola-rebeca-minguela-ceo-clarity-joven-lider-mundial-20170315114211.html|title=El Foro Económico Mundial reconoce a la española Rebeca Minguela, CEO de Clarity, como Joven Líder Mundial|last=Press|first=Europa|date=2017-03-15|work=europapress.es|access-date=2017-04-17|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://elpais.com/elpais/2017/03/30/talento_digital/1490871985_041602.html|title=La única española que entra en el ‘top 100’ de los jóvenes líderes mundiales|last=País|first=Ediciones El|date=2017-03-31|work=EL PAÍS|access-date=2017-04-17|language=es}}</ref>
== Blink Booking == Minguela started Blink Booking in 2011 a travel mobile app to book hotels last minute in Europe.<ref name="HBR"/> Blink Booking was the first startup of a platform aimed at fostering entrepreneurship in Spain.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.hbs.edu/faculty/Pages/item.aspx?num=43759|title=Blink Booking|work=hbs.edu}}</ref><ref name="forbes1">{{cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/hbsworkingknowledge/2013/08/26/building-a-startup-as-a-global-business|title=Building A Startup As A Global Business |publisher=[[Forbes]]|date=2013-08-26}}</ref> She joined Blink as full-time [[Chief Executive Officer|CEO]] in March 2012 due to an issue with her co-founder and to be able to manage the rapid growth of the company (as stated in [[Harvard Business School]] case about Blink Booking <ref name="autogenerated1"/>).
Blink Booking got investment from tech and travel investors ([[SoftTech VC]], ProFounders – [[Brent Hoberman]], Charles Petruccelli and [[American Express]] Travel (UVET Italy), [[Radisson Hotels]], Kibo ventures and others <ref>{{cite news|url=https://gigaom.com/2012/05/04/hotel-booking-app-blink-scores-2-5m-in-funding/|title=Hotel app Blink scores funding |publisher=[[GigaOm]]|date=2012-05-04}}</ref>). Blink app was available in 6 languages, [[Android (operating system)|Android]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.sbits.blink&hl=en|title=Blink by Groupon - Android Apps on Google Play|author=Blink Booking|work=google.com}}</ref> [[iOS]] / [[iPhone]] <ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/blink-by-groupon/id471326062?mt=8|title=Blink by Groupon|author=Innovative Mobile Apps Europe SL|date=18 October 2011|work=App Store}}</ref> and HTML5 in 8 different European countries.
Blink Booking was advertised in Spanish and Italian TV, and the TV advert "''The Lady in White''"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blinkbooking.com/es/campaign/tvSpot|title=Blink by Groupon|work=Blink Hotels|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150526101513/http://blinkbooking.com/es/campaign/tvSpot|archivedate=2015-05-26|df=}}</ref> was awarded with the "''Sol de Bronce''" award in 2013 ([[Festival Iberoamericano de Publicidad]], FIAP).<ref name="marketingdirecto.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.marketingdirecto.com/actualidad/eventos-y-formacion/los-34-premios-que-espana-se-ha-traido-a-casa-de-fiap2013/|title=Los 34 premios que España se ha traído a casa de #FIAP2013|work=Marketing Directo}}</ref>
In September 2013, Blink Booking was acquired by [[Groupon]] to strengthen its travel and mobile business. Blink Booking is now "[[:es:Blink by Groupon|Blink by Groupon]]",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://techcrunch.com/2013/09/09/groupon-blinks/|title=Groupon Acquires HotelTonight Competitor Blink To Get In On The Last Minute Hotel Booking App Action|author=Steve O'Hear|publisher=AOL|work=TechCrunch}}</ref> and Minguela started then working for Groupon.<ref name="venturebeat1"/>
== Public speaking, press and awards ==
Minguela and Blink Booking (the company she started and managed) have been mentioned in the press in several countries with features in publications including ''[[Forbes]]'',<ref name="forbes1"/> ''[[The Economist]]'',<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/blogs/gulliver/2012/10/x-0|title=Book late to book cheap|publisher=The Economist|date=2012-10-19}}</ref> ''[[Financial Times]]'',<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/d0e7ca22-db19-11e1-8074-00144feab49a.html|title=Hotels probe looks at room for competitors|publisher=[[Financial Times]]|date=2012-07-31}}</ref> ''The Sun'' (printed edition), ''[[El País]]'',<ref name="ElPais"/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://elpais.com/m/elpais/2012/02/06/inenglish/1328548209_292950.html|title=How your cellphone can help you find a hot hotel deal|publisher=[[El País]]|date=2012-02-06}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://economia.elpais.com/economia/2012/09/28/actualidad/1348842915_676591.html|title=Los emprendedores (tambien) emigran|publisher=[[El País]]|date=2012-09-30}}</ref> ''[[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]]'',<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.elmundo.es/blogs/elmundo/applicate/2012/09/01/hoteles-de-ultima-hora.html|title=Hoteles de ultima hora|publisher=[[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]]|date=2012-09-01}}</ref> ''[[Il Sole 24 Ore]]'',<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.ilsole24ore.com/art/tecnologie/2013-04-25/unapp-prenotazioni-albergo-lastsecond-090501.shtml?uuid=AbVTyPqH|title=Dai viaggi ai vestiti: le dieci app che ti fanno risparmiare|publisher=[[Il Sole 24 Ore]]}}</ref> and many others. Minguela's entrepreneurship platform and Blink Booking are also the subject of a business case at Harvard Business School.<ref name="autogenerated1"/> Minguela has been a speaker at several events and conferences, among them: ''Harvard European Conference 2015''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://europeanconference.org/2015-agenda/|title=Schedule|work=European Conference at Harvard and Fletcher}}</ref> - sharing the panel with the Director General for the [[European Commission]] -, ''Spain Tech Week Silicon Valley/ Seattle 2014'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://agencias.abc.es/agencias/noticia.asp?noticia=1603508|title=Seattle cautiva a emprendedores españoles como alternativa a Silicon Valley|work=ABC}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.californiaspainchamber.org/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&id=260:spain-tech-week-2014&Itemid=46&lang=en|title=SPAIN TECH WEEK 2014|work=californiaspainchamber.org}}</ref> ''Startup Spain 3.0''., "Red Innova 2013" <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.redinnova.com/2014/01/17/blink-lujo-y-descuentos-en-reservas-de-ultima-hora/|title=Blink, lujo y descuentos en reservas de última hora|work=Red Innova}}</ref>
Blink has been Top rated app by Apple Store and Google Play in several countries. It was also awarded "''Travel Pioneer of the Year 2012''" (Travolution Awards, from [[Travel Weekly]]),<ref name="travolution1"/> "''Travel App of the Week''" by Female First,<ref name="shabanaadam"/> and was finalist of 5th edition of ''Open Talent Award 2013'' to most innovative start-ups.<ref name="centrodeinnovacionbbva1"/> Blink Booking TV advert "''The Lady in White''" was awarded with the "''Sol de Bronce''" award in 2013 ([[Festival Iberoamericano de Publicidad]], FIAP).<ref name="marketingdirecto.com"/>
Rebeca has been named female [[role model]] entrepreneur in Spain by El Referente in April 2016.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.elreferente.es/tecnologicos/mujeres-emprendedoras-espana-29562|title = 75 mujeres emprendedoras de referencia en España|last = Referente|first = El|date = 2016-04-17|website = www.elreferente.es|language = es|access-date = 2016-05-16}}</ref>

'''Rolf Eckrodt''' (born 25 June 1942 in [[Gronau, North Rhine-Westphalia|Gronau]], [[Germany]]) is a German automotive engineer and executive, who started his career with [[Daimler-Benz]] in 1966 and was [[CEO]] of the [[Mitsubishi Motors Corporation]] from 2001-2005. He is the only non-Japanese person who has held the position so far.
==Career== Mr. Eckrodt has spent most of is professional life in the automotive industry, but he also spent 6 years as President and later Chairman of [[ADtranz]],<ref name="ec">{{cite web|url=http://www.referenceforbusiness.com/biography/A-E/Eckrodt-Rolf-1942.html|title=Rolf Eckrodt|work=www.referenceforbusiness.com}}</ref> an [[ABB Group|ABB]] [[DaimlerChrysler]] joint venture in the railway rolling stock and signalling business areas.
After the sale of [[ADtranz]] to [[Bombardier Inc.]], Mr. Eckrodt took an executive position at Mitsubishi Motors in Japan.<ref name="ec"/> When [[Daimler AG|DaimlerChrysler]] decided to sell their shares in Mitsubishi Motors in November 2005, Mr. Eckrodt stepped down and retired after 38 years in the auto industry. <ref name=Autoweb>[http://www.autoweb.com.au/cms/A_101336/title_Rolf-Eckrodt-Steps-Down-as-President-and-CEO-of-Mitsubishi-Motors/newsarticle.html "Rolf Eckrodt Steps Down as President and CEO of Mitsubishi Motors"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091114062304/http://www.autoweb.com.au/cms/A_101336/title_Rolf-Eckrodt-Steps-Down-as-President-and-CEO-of-Mitsubishi-Motors/newsarticle.html |date=2009-11-14 }}, 27 April 2004, AutoWeb.</ref>
From 2008 - 2013 Mr Eckrodt has been the chairman of the Board of THE FRANK LATZER GROUP and from 2010 - 2013 of Leclanche SA.<ref>{{cite web|title=Rolf Eckrodt|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=1890061&ticker=LECN:SW&previousCapId=5479406&previousTitle=TOGNUM%20AG |publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]|work=investing.businessweek.com}}</ref>

{{Infobox person | name = Sam Altman | image = File:Sam Altman in 2009.jpg | caption = Altman in 2009 | birth_name = Samuel H. Altman | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|04|22|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], [[US]] | residence = [[San Francisco]], [[California]], [[US]]{{cite web|title=Sam Altman |url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/sam-altman#/entity |website=CrunchBase |publisher=[[TechCrunch]] |accessdate=4 April 2016 }} | nationality = American | citizenship = [[United States]] | alma_mater = [[Stanford University]] (dropped out) | occupation = [[Entrepreneur]] | known_for = [[Loopt]], [[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]], [[OpenAI]] | networth = | title = President of [[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]] | spouse = | children = | website = {{Official URL}} | signature = }} '''Samuel H.''' "'''Sam'''" '''Altman''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|ɔː|l|t|m|ən}}; born April 22, 1985) is an American [[entrepreneur]], [[investor]], [[programmer]], and [[blog]]ger.{{cite web |url=http://blog.samaltman.com |title=Sam Altman |work=SamAltman.com |accessdate=December 15, 2015}} He is the president of [[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]] and co-chairman of [[OpenAI]].{{cite web |first=Paul |last=Graham |url=http://blog.ycombinator.com/sam-altman-for-president |title=Sam Altman for President |work=Y Combinator |date=April 24, 2014 |accessdate=March 20, 2017}}{{cite web | title=OpenAI | url=https://openai.com/blog/introducing-openai/ | accessdate=March 20, 2017}} ==Early life and education== Altman grew up in [[St. Louis, Missouri]], his mother was a dermatologist. He received his first computer at the age of 8,{{cite web |first=Tom |last=Junod |title=How Venture Capitalists Find Opportunities in the Future |url=http://www.esquire.com/news-politics/interviews/a30763/sam-altman-interview-2014/ |work=[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]] |date=December 18, 2014 |accessdate=December 15, 2015}} He was raised Jewish and is gay.{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/10/10/sam-altmans-manifest-destiny|title=Sam Altman’s Manifest Destiny|website=NewYorker.com|publisher=The New Yorker|accessdate=17 May 2017}} He attended [[John Burroughs School]] for high school and studied computer science at [[Stanford University]] until dropping out in 2005.{{cite web |title=People |url=http://ycombinator.com/people.html |work=[[Y Combinator (company)|Y Combinator]] |accessdate=December 15, 2015}} While studying at Stanford, he worked in the [[Stanford Artificial Intelligence Lab|AI Lab]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/sam-altman#section-overview|title=Sam Altman - President, YC Group @ Y Combinator {{!}} Crunchbase|website=Crunchbase|language=en|access-date=2018-02-20}}. In 2017 he received an honorary degree from the [[University of Waterloo]].{{cite web | url=https://uwaterloo.ca/registrar/spring-2017-honorary-and-award-recipients | title=Spring 2017 honorary and award recipients | publisher=University of Waterloo | work=Registrar's Office | accessdate=July 7, 2017}} ==Career== ===Loopt=== In 2005, at age 19,{{cite web |first=Jason |last=Ankeny |title=Meet Y Combinator's Bold Whiz Kid Boss |url=http://www.entrepreneur.com/article/244508 |date=April 25, 2015 |accessdate=December 15, 2015}} Altman [[entrepreneur|co-founded]] and became [[chief executive officer|CEO]] of [[Loopt]],{{cite web|url=http://www.loopt.com/about/company/executives |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120216022416/http://www.loopt.com/about/company/executives/ |archive-date=February 16, 2012 |title=Executives |accessdate=December 15, 2015 |work=[[Loopt]]}} a location-based [[social networking service|social networking]] [[mobile software|mobile application]]. Loopt was shut down in 2012 after failing to get traction and was acquired by the [[Green Dot Corporation]] for more than $43 million.{{cite news | title=Startup Loopt Lands with Green Dot | date=March 9, 2012 | work=[[Wall Street Journal]] | url =https://blogs.wsj.com/digits/2012/03/09/startup-loopt-lands-with-green-dot/| accessdate = March 13, 2012}}{{Cite news|url=https://mastersofscale.com/sam-altman-why-customer-love-is-all-you-need/|title=Sam Altman: Why customer love is all you need {{!}} Masters of Scale podcast|work=WaitWhat|access-date=2018-03-20|language=en-US}} ===Y Combinator=== Altman began as a part-time partner at [[Y Combinator]] in 2011.{{Cite web|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/person/sam-altman#section-overview|title=Sam Altman - President, YC Group @ Y Combinator {{!}} Crunchbase|website=Crunchbase|language=en|access-date=2018-02-20}} In 2014, Altman was named president of Y Combinator, whose first batch of investments included Loopt.{{cite web |first=Paul |last=Graham |url=http://blog.ycombinator.com/sam-altman-for-president |title=Sam Altman for President |work=Y Combinator |date=April 24, 2014 |accessdate=December 15, 2015}} In a 2014 blog post, Altman said that the total valuation of Y Combinator companies had surpassed $65 billion, including well-known companies like [[Airbnb]], [[Dropbox (service)|Dropbox]], [[Zenefits]] and [[Stripe (company)|Stripe]].{{cite news|url=https://blog.ycombinator.com/yc-stats |accessdate=December 19, 2015|title=YC Stats | publisher=Y Combinator | date=August 26, 2015}} In September 2016, Altman announced that he would become president of YC Group, which includes Y Combinator and other units.{{cite web|first=Sam|last=Altman|url=https://blog.ycombinator.com/yc-changes|title=YC Changes |work=Y Combinator |accessdate=November 7, 2016}} Altman has said that he hopes to expand Y Combinator to fund 1,000 new companies per year. He has also tried to expand the types of companies funded by YC, especially 'hard technology' companies.{{cite news|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/3044282/the-y-combinator-chronicles/california-dreamin |accessdate=July 22, 2015|title=Y Combinator President Sam Altman is Dreaming Big| website=Fast Company | date=April 16, 2015}} In October 2015, Altman announced YC Continuity, a $700 million growth-stage [[equity fund]] that invests in YC companies.{{cite news|url=http://blog.ycombinator.com/yc-continuity-fund |accessdate=December 19, 2015|title=YC Continuity | publisher=Y Combinator | date=October 15, 2015}}
- {{cite news|url=https://venturebeat.com/2015/10/15/y-combinator-raises-700m-to-keep-funding-yc-startups-as-they-mature/ |accessdate=December 19, 2015|title=YC Continuity | website=VentureBeat | date=October 15, 2015}} Also in October 2015, Altman announced Y Combinator Research, a non-profit research lab, and donated $10 million to the group.{{cite news|url=https://blog.ycombinator.com/yc-research | accessdate=February 19, 2016 | title=YC Research | publisher=Y Combinator | date=October 7, 2015}} YC Research has thus far announced research on basic income, the future of computing, education, and building new cities.{{cite web|title=Y Combinator Research|url=https://ycr.org/|website=YC Research|accessdate=3 August 2016}} Altman was named the top investor under 30 by ''[[Forbes]]'' in 2015,{{cite news | title= Forbes' 30 Under 30 2015: Venture Capital | date=January 5, 2015| url =https://www.forbes.com/30under30/#/venture-capital | work =[[Forbes]] | accessdate = February 28, 2015}} one of the "Best Young Entrepreneurs in Technology" by ''[[BusinessWeek]]'' in 2008{{cite news | title= Tech’s Best Young Entrepreneurs | date=April 18, 2008 | url =http://images.businessweek.com/ss/07/03/0326_tech_entrepreneurs/source/9.htm | work =[[BusinessWeek]] | accessdate = April 19, 2009}} and listed as one of the five most interesting startup founders between 1979 and 2009 by his colleague [[Paul Graham (computer programmer)|Paul Graham]].{{cite web|url=http://www.paulgraham.com/5founders.html |title=Five Founders |accessdate=April 19, 2009|authorlink=Paul Graham (computer programmer)|last=Graham |first=Paul |date=April 2009 }} ===Angel investing=== He is a personal investor in many companies, including [[Airbnb]], [[Stripe (company)|Stripe]], [[Reddit]], [[Asana_(software)|Asana]], [[Pinterest]], [[Teespring]], [[Zenefits]], FarmLogs, [[Shoptiques]], [[Instacart]], [[Optimizely]], [[Verbling]], [[Soylent_(drink)|Soylent]], Reserve, Vicarious, Clever, Notable PDF{{cite web|last1=Altman|first1=Sam|title=Angel List|url=https://angel.co/sama/syndicate|website=Angel List|publisher=|accessdate=April 20, 2015}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/tech/s/notable-pdf-built-annotation-tool-130003639.html|title=How Notable PDF built an annotation tool for PDFs on the web|last=|first=|date=2017-04-05|website=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170405210802/https://www.yahoo.com/tech/notable-pdf-built-annotation-tool-130003639.html|archive-date=2017-04-05|dead-url=|access-date=2018-03-26}} and [[Change.org]].{{cite web|title=Change.org - Investors {{!}} CrunchBase|url=https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/change-org/investors|website=CrunchBase|accessdate=3 August 2016}} He was the CEO of [[Reddit]] for eight days in 2014 after CEO [[Yishan Wong]] resigned.{{cite news|url=http://blog.samaltman.com/a-new-team-at-reddit |accessdate=February 13, 2015|title=A New Team At Reddit | publisher=Sam Altman | date=November 13, 2014}} As part of his investment, he developed a new way for the community to own part of the company. He announced the return of Steve Huffman as CEO on July 10, 2015.{{cite web|url=https://www.reddit.com/comments/3cucye/ |title=An Old Team At Reddit |accessdate=July 13, 2015 |publisher=[[reddit]] }} ===Nuclear energy=== He is chairman of the board for [[Helion Energy|Helion]] and Oklo, two nuclear energy companies. He has said that nuclear energy is one of the most important areas of technological development.{{cite web|url=http://blog.samaltman.com/energy/ | title=Energy |accessdate=July 13, 2015 |publisher=Sam Altman }} ===OpenAI=== Altman and [[Elon Musk]] were the co-chairmen of [[OpenAI]]. OpenAI is a [[Nonprofit organization|nonprofit]] whose goal is to advance digital intelligence in a way that is most likely to benefit humanity as a whole, rather than cause harm.{{cite web | title=OpenAI | url=https://openai.com/blog/introducing-openai/ | accessdate=December 15, 2015}} On February 21 2018, Elon Musk left [[OpenAI]]'s board to avoid any conflict of interest with [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]].{{cite web | title=Elon Musk Leaves OpenAI board | url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/2/21/17036214/elon-musk-openai-ai-safety-leaves-board | accessdate=February 21, 2018}} ==Teaching== In fall 2014, he taught a class at [[Stanford University]] called "[http://startupclass.samaltman.com/ How To Start a Startup]". Guest lecturers included [[Paul Graham (computer programmer)|Paul Graham]], [[Peter Thiel]], Adora Cheung, Alex Schultz, [[Marc Andreessen]], [[Ron Conway]], Carolynn Levy, Kirsty Nathoo, [[Ben Horowitz]], [[Brian Chesky]], [[Alfred Lin]], [[Aaron Levie]], [[Reid Hoffman]], Kevin Hale, [[Ben Silbermann]] and [[Emmett Shear]]. He currently teaches Y Combinator Startup School, a 10-week course featuring guests including Stewart Butterfield, Adam D'Angelo, and Dustin Moskovitz.{{cite web|url=https://www.startupschool.org/|website=Startup School |title= STARTUP SCHOOL BY Y COMBINATOR | access-date= April 25, 2017}} ==Writing== Altman occasionally posts to his [http://blog.samaltman.com blog], mostly about startups and technology. He also wrote [http://playbook.samaltman.com Startup Playbook], a distillation of advice that Y Combinator gives to its startups.{{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.com/Startup-Playbook-Sam-Altman-ebook/dp/B0181ZPASC|title=Startup Playbook|last=Altman|first=Sam|others=Gregory Koberger|language=English}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://blog.samaltman.com Altman's blog] (2010 to date) * [http://playbook.samaltman.com Startup Playbook] (2016) * [http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/10/10/sam-altmans-manifest-destiny Sam Altman’s Manifest Destiny]. "Is the head of Y Combinator fixing the world, or trying to take over Silicon Valley?" By [[Tad Friend]] (October 2016), ''[[The New Yorker]]'' * [https://archive.is/20130126114430/http://www.inc.com/30under30/2007/4-altman.html Inc.: Top 30 Entrepreneurs Under 30 - Sam Altman, Loopt] (2007) * [http://tusb.stanford.edu/2007/05/sam_altman_founder_of_loopt.html Sam Altman - Founder of Loopt (the unofficial Stanford blog)] (2007) {{DEFAULTSORT:Altman, Sam}} [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:American computer programmers]] [[Category:American Jews]] [[Category:Businesspeople in information technology]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Stanford University alumni]] [[Category:1985 births]] [[Category: LGBT people from Missouri]] [[Category: Gay men]] [[Category:Y Combinator people]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Financial markets}}
{{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} In [[company (law)|corporate law]], a '''stock certificate''' (also known as '''certificate of stock''' or '''share certificate''') is a legal document that certifies [[ownership]] of a specific number of [[share (finance)|share]]s or [[stock]] in a [[corporation]]. Historically, certificates may have been required to evidence entitlement to [[dividend]]s, with a receipt for the payment being endorsed on the back; and the original certificate may have been required to be provided to effect the transfer of the shareholding. Over time, these functions have been rendered redundant by statutory schemes to streamline the administrative burden on corporations, and to facilitate and streamline trading on a [[stock exchange]]. For example, most jurisdictions now impose an obligation on corporations to pay dividends to shareholders registered at a relevant point of time without the need to produce the share certificate as proof of entitlement and the certificate is no longer required to be produced with a transfer of a shareholding. In some jurisdictions today, the issue of paper stock certificates may be dispensed with, at least in some circumstances, and many corporations now provide a '''holding statement''' in lieu of a share certificate for each parcel of shares owned.
Most jurisdictions now require corporations to maintain records of ownership or transfers of shareholdings, and do not permit share certificates to be issued to [[bearer instrument|bearer]].
==History== Ruben Schalk, history student at the [[Universiteit Utrecht]], discovered (2010) the so far oldest share certificate in the world in the [[Westfries Archief]] in [[Hoorn]]. The certificate dates from 9 September 1606 and was issued by the [[Dutch East India Company|VOC]]-chamber [[Enkhuizen]]. It was sold to Pieter Hermanszoon Boode. The second page records the payments of dividend.
In the United States and other countries, electronic registration is supplanting the stock certificate, with both public and private companies no longer being required to issue paper certificates.<ref>{{cite web|author=Todd Miller|url=https://www.capshare.com/blog/why-private-companies-dont-need-to-issue-stock-certificates/|title=Why Private Companies Don’t Need To Issue Stock Certificates|date=25 September 2015|accessdate=3 February 2013}}</ref> In the United States over 420 of the 7,000-plus publicly traded securities do not issue paper certificates.<ref>{{cite web|author=Matt Krantz|publisher=USA Today|date=25 May 2010|accessdate=7 September 2010|title= Electronic records are replacing paper stock certificates |url=https://www.usatoday.com/money/markets/2010-05-25-certificates19_ST_N.htm}}</ref> The United States' [[Central Securities Depository]], the [[Depository Trust Company|DTC]], has continued to promote efforts to completely eliminate paper stock certificates, a process called [[dematerialization (securities)|dematerialization]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dtcc.com/news/2013/march/12/full_dematerialization.aspx/|title=DTCC Proposes Steps to Move Ahead on Full Dematerialization of Physical Securities|date=12 March 2013|accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref> Countries around the world have adopted similar initiatives with many countries setting deadlines for statutory dematerialization.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ec.europa.eu/internal_market/financial-markets/docs/certainty/background/30_8_5_martinez-calcerrada_en.pdf/|title=Note On Statutory Dematerialisation Across the European Union|accessdate=3 February 2015}}</ref>
Brokers may charge up to $500 for issuing a paper certificate, though this fee can be avoided by either holding share in [[Street name securities|street name]] (in the United States street name securities are securities held electronically in the account of a stockbroker, similar to a bank account) or registering shares directly with the [[stock transfer agent]] and having them issue the certificate.<ref>{{cite web|author=Matt Krantz|publisher=USA Today|date=10 June 2010|accessdate=7 September 2010|title=Free paper stock certificates? It's possible but does take work |url=https://www.usatoday.com/money/perfi/columnist/krantz/2010-05-25-paper-stock-certificates_N.htm}}</ref>
Another alternative to both paper and electronic registration is the use of paper-equivalent electronic stock certificates. Forty-seven states have enacted legislation equivalent to the [[Uniform Electronic Transactions Act]], which formalizes equivalency for [[electronic signature]]s "in writing" requirements. This, together with the enactment of legislation permitting the use of "[[facsimile]]" signatures on certificates (such as in §158 of the [[Delaware General Corporation Law]]), has given rise to [[software as a service]] technology<ref>{{cite web|author=Connie Loizos|publisher=PeHUB|title=Cofounded by Manu Kumar, eShares Aims to (Finally) Digitize Stock and Options Certificates|url=http://www.pehub.com/2013/03/06/cofounded-manu-kumar-eshares-aims-finally-digitize-stock-options-certificates/|accessdate=13 June 2013|date=6 March 2013}}</ref> for private companies to create, issue and manage paper-equivalent electronic stock certificates.
In [[Sweden]], share certificates have been largely abolished, people using electronic shares instead (which are either registered in the share owner's name or in the share owner's broker's name). Share certificates may exist in Sweden, but only if the shares are not listed on any stock exchange in Sweden, and the availability of share certificates has nothing to do with voting in shareholders' general meetings.
Sometimes a shareholder with a stock certificate can give a [[Proxy voting|proxy]] to another person to allow them to vote the shares in question. Similarly, a shareholder without a share certificate may often give a proxy to another person to allow them to vote the shares in question. Voting rights are defined by the corporation's charter and corporate law.
Stock certificates are generally divided into two forms: registered stock certificates and [[bearer stock certificate]]s. A registered stock certificate is normally only evidence of title, and a record of the true holders of the shares will appear in the stockholder's register of the corporation.
A bearer stock certificate, as its name implies is a [[bearer instrument]], and physical possession of the certificate entitles the holder to exercise all legal rights associated with the stock. Bearer stock certificates are becoming uncommon: they were popular in [[offshore financial centre|offshore jurisdiction]]s for their perceived confidentiality, and as a useful way to transfer beneficial title to assets (held by the corporation) without payment of [[stamp duty]]. International initiatives have curbed the use of bearer stock certificates in offshore jurisdictions, and tend to be available only in onshore financial centres, although they are rarely seen in practice.
==Legal characterization of a stock certificate== A stock certificate represents a legal proprietary interest in the common stock (in the sense of the general fund) or assets of the issuer corporation. The certificate evidences a [[chose in action]] against the issuer to collect dividends and usually to influence the issuer through voting pursuant to the issuer's [[charter]] and [[bylaws]], which are often implied or incorporated by reference as terms on the face of the certificate.
Stockholder rights are subject to the solvency requirements of issuer's general creditors and to any terms and conditions validly placed upon the face of the stock certificate which are part of the total agreement between the particular stockholder and the issuer.
Stock certificates are transferred as negotiable or quasi-negotiable instruments by indorsement and delivery, and issuer charters typically require that transfers must be registered with the issuer (usually via the issuer's transfer agent) in order for the transferee to join as a member of the corporation. Registration of transfer is a type of [[novation]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://scholarship.law.marquette.edu/mulr/vol5/iss2/6|title=The Uniform Stock Transfer Act |first= Clarence G. |last=Ehrle|publisher=}}</ref>
There are old company research websites that can determine, for a fee, whether or not an old stock certificate or bond certificate has collectible or redeemable value.<ref>[http://www.oldcompany.com oldcompany.com]</ref>
==See also== * [[Bearer bond]] * [[Bearer instrument]] * [[Scripophily]] * [[Revenue stamps of the United States|Stock certificates franked with revenue tax stamps]] * [[Dematerialization (securities)]] * [[Direct holding system]]
==Gallery== <gallery> File:VOC aandeel 9 september 1606.jpg|One of the oldest known stock certificates, issued by the [[Dutch East India Company|VOC]]-chamber of [[Enkhuizen]], dated 9 September 1606 File:B&O RR common stock.jpg|[[Baltimore and Ohio Railroad]] stock certificate, 1903 File:Argonaut Oil & Mining Co stock 1900 and rev stamps.jpg|Stock certificate, 1900, [[franking|franked]] with [[Revenue stamps of the United States|Revenue tax stamps]] (upper left) File:New Jersey Midland Railway Co 1872.JPG|New Jersey Midland Railway Co., 1872 </gallery>
